# activationPolicy

**Instance Property**

Indicates the activation policy of the application.

## Declaration

```swift
var activationPolicy: NSApplication.ActivationPolicy { get }
```

## Discussion

The value returned by this property is usually fixed, but it may change through a call to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activate(options:)].

This property is observable using key-value observing.

## Activating applications

- **activate(options:)**: Attempts to activate the application using the specified options.
- **activate(from:options:)**: Attempts to activate the application using the specified options.
- **isActive**: Indicates whether the application is currently frontmost.
- **NSApplication.ActivationOptions**: The following flags are for [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activate(options:)].
- **NSApplication.ActivationPolicy**: Activation policies (used by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activationPolicy]) that control whether and how an app may be activated.
